summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) prosecutors discussing the imminent indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell, speculation about her location, and personal updates. It reveals internal coordination and timing of the Maxwell indictment.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the email chain; prosecutors state they are indicting her next week and speculate she might be in Paris.

events.title: Email discussing Maxwell indictment
events.description: Prosecutors exchange emails confirming plans to indict Ghislaine Maxwell the following week and discuss her possible location.

events.title: Prosecutor breaks foot
events.description: One prosecutor mentions having broken their foot a few weeks prior and wearing a boot.

keyFacts: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were planning to indict Ghislaine Maxwell the week following June 25, 2020.
There was speculation among prosecutors that Maxwell might be 'holed up in Paris,' though one email suggests a 'Paris report is inaccurate.'
The correspondence indicates internal coordination and personal updates among the prosecution team during the lead-up to Maxwell's indictment.
